urgent_near_10_median.long_name: Emergency medical services availability by median drive time to the ten closest facilities in minutes
urgent_near_10_median.short_description: Median drive time (minutes) to the ten closest emergency medical services facilities
urgent_near_10_median.long_description: Median drive time in minutes to the ten closest emergency medical services facilities. Facility location data were collected from the Homeland Infrastructure Foundation-Level Data (HIFLD) repository. Drive times were computed using Open Source Routing Machine (Using roads for year 2021).
urgent_near_10_median.statement: The median drive time to the ten closest emergency medical service facilities to {features.name} is {value}.

urgent_cnt.long_name: Availability of emergency medical services by count
urgent_cnt.short_description: Count of emergency medical services facilities based on facility locations
urgent_cnt.long_description: Count of emergency medical services facilities based on facility locations. Location data was collected from the Homeland Infrastructure Foundation-Level Data (HIFLD) repository.
urgent_cnt.statement: There are {value} emergency medical services facilities in {features.name}.

urgent_3sfca.long_name: Emergency medical services geographic availability (3-step floating catchment areas)
urgent_3sfca.short_description: Index of emergency medical services availability based on supply and demand of facilities
urgent_3sfca.long_description: Emergency medical services availability based on 3-step floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of facilities per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a facility is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for facilities (adult population).
urgent_3sfca.statement: The emergency medical services availability for {features.name} is {value}.

lou04.title: Using a gis-based floating catchment method to assess areas with shortage of physicians

lou09.title: An enhanced two-step floating catchment area (e2sfca) method for measuring spatial accessibility to primary care physicians

lou03.title: Measures of spatial accessibility to health care in a gis environment: synthesis and a case study in the Chicago region
lou03.journal: Environment and Planning B: Planning and Design

saxon20.title: An Open Software Environment to Make Spatial Access Metrics More Accessible
saxon20.journal: University of Chicago: Center for Spatial Data Science
